title: Hanoi Climate Overview
content: Hanoi experiences a humid subtropical climate with four distinct seasons. Winter (December-February) is cool and dry with average temperatures of 15-20°C. Spring (March-May) is warm and humid. Summer (June-August) is hot and rainy with temperatures reaching 30-35°C. Autumn (September-November) is mild and pleasant. The city receives most of its rainfall during the summer monsoon season from May to September.

title: Best Time to Visit Hanoi
content: The best time to visit Hanoi is during autumn (September to November) and spring (March to April) when the weather is most pleasant. Temperatures are mild, ranging from 20°C to 28°C, with lower humidity and minimal rainfall. These seasons offer ideal conditions for exploring the city's attractions, street food, and cultural sites without the extreme heat or cold.

title: Hanoi Weather Patterns
content: Hanoi's weather is influenced by the monsoon climate. The northeast monsoon brings cool, dry weather from November to March. The southwest monsoon brings hot, humid weather with heavy rains from May to September. Transition months (April and October) experience variable weather. The city averages 1,680mm of rainfall annually, with the wettest months being July and August.
